title: Getting Started with Next.js 14: A Comprehensive Guide
description: Learn how to build modern web applications with Next.js 14, featuring App Router, Server Components, and advanced optimization techniques.

body.raw:
# Getting Started with Next.js 14 Next.js 14 introduces powerful new features that make building modern web applications faster and more efficient. In this comprehensive guide, we'll explore the latest features and best practices. ## What Makes Next.js 14 Special? Next.js 14 brings significant improvements to the developer experience and application performance: - **App Router**: A new routing paradigm with nested layouts and loading states - **Server Components**: Render components on the server for better performance - **Turbopack**: A faster bundler for development (still experimental) - **Improved Image Optimization**: Better performance and WebP support ## Setting Up Your First Next.js 14 Project ```bash npx create-next-app@latest my-app --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app cd my-app npm run dev ``` This command creates a new Next.js project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, ESLint, and the new App Router. ## Understanding the App Router The App Router introduces a new way to organize your application: ``` app/ ├── layout.tsx # Root layout ├── page.tsx # Home page ├── about/ │ ├── page.tsx # About page │ └── layout.tsx # About layout └── blog/ ├── page.tsx # Blog listing └── [slug]/ └── page.tsx # Individual blog post ``` ## Server Components vs Client Components ### Server Components (Default) ```tsx // app/components/ServerComponent.tsx export default function ServerComponent() { // This runs on the server const data = fetchDataFromAPI() return (

Server Component

Data: {data}

) } ``` ### Client Components ```tsx // app/components/ClientComponent.tsx 'use client' import { useState } from 'react' export default function ClientComponent() { const [count, setCount] = useState(0) return } ``` ## Advanced Features ### Loading States ```tsx // app/blog/loading.tsx export default function Loading() { return (
) } ``` ### Error Boundaries ```tsx // app/error.tsx 'use client' export default function Error({ error, reset, }: { error: Error reset: () => void }) { return (

Something went wrong!

) } ``` ## Performance Optimization ### Image Optimization ```tsx import Image from 'next/image' export default function OptimizedImage() { return ( ) } ``` ## Conclusion Next.js 14 represents a significant leap forward in React development. The App Router, Server Components, and improved performance features make it easier than ever to build fast, scalable web applications. Start building with Next.js 14 today and experience the future of React development!

  reset,

  reset: () => void
}) {

      <h2>Something went wrong!</h2>

    </div>
  )
}

}
